skill.name: project-planning
skill.description: Generate initial project planning documents (PVS, ADR, Tech Spec, Roadmap) from a project concept description. Use when starting a new project, when docs/planning/ contains placeholder files, or when user requests project planning document generation.
skill.summary: Generate initial project planning documents (PVS, ADR, Tech Spec, Roadmap) from a project concept de...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based AI skill for document generation. Contains only markdown templates and a validation script. No network access, no credential access, no code execution beyond local file validation. All behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Starting a new project without clear planning leads to scope creep and architectural drift. This skill generates four essential planning documents from your project concept, providing structured guidance for AI-assisted development that maintains context across sessions.
actual_capabilities: Generate Project Vision & Scope document from project description
Create Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) with alternatives and rationale
Produce Technical Implementation Specification with tech stack and architecture
Build Development Roadmap with phased implementation plan
Validate generated documents for completeness and consistency
Synthesize all documents into actionable PROJECT-PLAN.md
limitations: Requires user to provide initial project description and requirements
Does not execute code or modify existing project files directly
Expert consensus review requires zen-mcp-server availability
Generated documents need human review for accuracy

use_cases.title: New Project Kickoff
use_cases.description: Generate complete planning package for new Python projects to establish architecture and roadmap before coding begins.

use_cases.title: Context Management
use_cases.description: Create reference documents that maintain project context across multiple AI coding sessions without context overflow.

use_cases.title: Architectural Decisions
use_cases.description: Document key technical choices with clear rationale using ADR templates to prevent future confusion.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Planning Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: /plan I want to build a CLI tool for managing personal finances with budgeting and expense tracking features

prompt_templates.title: Add Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: /adr create database choice for storing transaction data with offline support and future cloud sync capability

prompt_templates.title: Synthesize Project Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Synthesize my planning documents into a project plan with git branch strategy

prompt_templates.title: Validate Documents
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the validation script to check my planning documents for completeness and missing placeholders

best_practices: Generate all four documents before development begins to establish shared context
Use the zen-mcp-server consensus tool to validate document quality before proceeding
Reference planning documents during implementation to maintain architectural alignment
Update documents when scope changes or new architectural decisions are made
anti_patterns: Skipping planning and starting code immediately leads to architectural drift
Using generated documents as fixed requirements instead of living documents
Creating overly generic documents that could apply to any project
Ignoring validation warnings about placeholders or missing sections

faq.question: What planning documents are generated?
faq.answer: Four documents: Project Vision & Scope, Technical Specification, Development Roadmap, and Architecture Decision Records.

faq.question: Do I need to install additional tools?
faq.answer: The skill works standalone. Optional zen-mcp-server enables expert consensus review of generated documents.

faq.question: Can I modify the document templates?
faq.answer: Yes, templates are in templates/ directory. Customize adr-template.md, pvs-template.md, tech-spec-template.md, or roadmap-template.md.

faq.question: How are documents validated?
faq.answer: The validate-planning-docs.py script checks for required sections, placeholder text, word counts, and cross-references between documents.

faq.question: What happens if I skip the consensus review?
faq.answer: You can proceed without consensus review. Documents are still generated and usable. Manual review by stakeholders is recommended.

faq.question: How is this different from other planning tools?
faq.answer: Designed specifically for AI-assisted development with Claude and Claude Code. Documents include prompting patterns for context loading during coding sessions.
